intro: Gomphocentrum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plants typically have palmately compound leaves and are often found in moist, shaded environments. Gomphocentrum species are known for their medicinal properties and are sometimes used in traditional medicine. They are also popular in horticulture due to their ornamental value.
